intro: Ectasis vestiflua, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Ectasis vestiflua is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
